bug.author: sdesrozis
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug description</denchmark-h>
Don't know if it's normal (because not yet stable feature) but using the following code : <denchmark-code>profiler = BasicTimeProfiler() profiler.attach(trainer) ... results = profiler.get_results() print(results) BasicTimeProfiler.print_results(profiler.get_results()) </denchmark-code>
and I got a runtime error (I put here stack including print msg) <denchmark-code>OrderedDict([('processing_stats', OrderedDict([('min/index', (0.002581869950518012, 937)), ('max/index', (0.24407817423343658, 0)), ('mean', 0.005071939900517464), ('std', 0.005763144697993994), ('total', 9.514959335327148)])), ('dataflow_stats', OrderedDict([('min/index', (5.4130003263708204e-05, 1874)), ('max/index', (0.02181326039135456, 1875)), ('mean', 0.00013960782962385565), ('std', 0.0006590772536583245), ('total', 0.2619042992591858)])), ('event_handlers_stats', {'EPOCH_STARTED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (6.137001037131995e-06, 0)), ('max/index', (1.3475997548084706e-05, 1)), ('mean', 9.80649929260835e-06), ('std', 5.189453986531589e-06), ('total', 1.96129985852167e-05)]), 'EPOCH_COMPLETED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (3.951500654220581, 0)), ('max/index', (4.009259223937988, 1)), ('mean', 3.980380058288574), ('std', 0.0408414751291275), ('total', 7.960760116577148)]), 'STARTED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (4.647001333069056e-06, 0)), ('max/index', (4.647001333069056e-06, 0)), ('mean', 4.647001333069056e-06), ('std', nan), ('total', 4.647001333069056e-06)]), 'COMPLETED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (0.001252603018656373, 0)), ('max/index', (0.001252603018656373, 0)), ('mean', 0.001252603018656373), ('std', nan), ('total', 0.001252603018656373)]), 'ITERATION_STARTED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (1.2870004866272211e-06, 931)), ('max/index', (1.6206002328544855e-05, 784)), ('mean', 2.0810284695471637e-06), ('std', 1.0310620837117312e-06), ('total', 0.003904009470716119)]), 'ITERATION_COMPLETED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (0.00041244301246479154, 6)), ('max/index', (0.0033979369327425957, 1706)), ('mean', 0.0005990439676679671), ('std', 0.00017004708934109658), ('total', 1.1238064765930176)]), 'GET_BATCH_STARTED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (2.2699969122186303e-06, 1871)), ('max/index', (6.306700379354879e-05, 1627)), ('mean', 3.619041763158748e-06), ('std', 2.3099164536688477e-06), ('total', 0.006789322476834059)]), 'GET_BATCH_COMPLETED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (1.471998984925449e-06, 934)), ('max/index', (1.4063996786717325e-05, 918)), ('mean', 2.3078853246261133e-06), ('std', 8.762469292378228e-07), ('total', 0.0043295929208397865)]), 'total_time': tensor(9.1009)}), ('event_handlers_names', {'EPOCH_STARTED_names': ['Metric.started'], 'EPOCH_COMPLETED_names': ['ProgressBar._close', 'log_training_results_fn', 'log_validation_results_fn'], 'STARTED_names': ['BasicTimeProfiler._as_first_started'], 'COMPLETED_names': ['ModelCheckpoint'], 'ITERATION_STARTED_names': [], 'ITERATION_COMPLETED_names': ['Metric.iteration_completed', 'Metric.completed', 'LRScheduler', '_OutputHandler', 'Engine._handler_wrapper.<locals>.wrapper', 'Engine._handler_wrapper.<locals>.wrapper'], 'GET_BATCH_STARTED_names': [], 'GET_BATCH_COMPLETED_names': []})]) Traceback (most recent call last): File "tutorials/mnist/mnist.py", line 228, in <module> BasicTimeProfiler.print_results(profiler.get_results()) File "/work/desrozis/Softwares/conda/envs/focus-light/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ignite/contrib/handlers/time_profilers.py", line 414, in print_results **others, KeyError: 'Events_STARTED' </denchmark-code>
There is no key Events_STARTED and more generaly no one begins with the Events_ prefix. Did I miss something ? Or is it the output_message variable in the time_profilers.py file which is corrupted ? Thanks for your help ! <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.4): 1.4 Ignite Version (e.g., 0.3.0): master OS (e.g., Linux): Linux How you installed Ignite (conda, pip, source): pip from sources Python version: 3.7 Any other relevant information: git tag 4dced08

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sdesrozis>@sdesrozis</denchmark-link> I can not reproduce your issue. Could you please provide a snippet to reproduce it. Here is mine import ignite print(ignite.__version__)
from ignite.contrib.handlers.time_profilers import BasicTimeProfiler from ignite.engine import Engine
trainer = Engine(lambda e, b: None) profiler = BasicTimeProfiler() profiler.attach(trainer)
trainer.run(list(range(10)), max_epochs=2)
results = profiler.get_results() # print(results) BasicTimeProfiler.print_results(profiler.get_results());
Output:
0.4.0.dev20200206
-------------------------------------------- - Time profiling results: --------------------------------------------
Processing function time stats (in seconds): min/index: (5.822163075208664e-06, 9) max/index: (7.409136742353439e-06, 0) mean: 6.1339001149463e-06 std: 3.797724161813676e-07 total: 0.0001226780004799366
Dataflow time stats (in seconds): min/index: (2.7878209948539734e-05, 7) max/index: (5.764095112681389e-05, 19) mean: 3.117644155281596e-05 std: 8.162835001712665e-06 total: 0.0006235288456082344
Time stats of event handlers (in seconds): - Total time spent: 0.00017259642481803894
- Events.STARTED: min/index: (6.504356861114502e-06, 0) max/index: (6.504356861114502e-06, 0) mean: 6.504356861114502e-06 std: nan total: 6.504356861114502e-06
Handlers names: ['BasicTimeProfiler._as_first_started']
- Events.EPOCH_STARTED: min/index: (1.7439015209674835e-06, 1) max/index: (2.5997869670391083e-06, 0) mean: 2.171844244003296e-06 std: 6.052023877600732e-07 total: 4.343688488006592e-06
Handlers names: []
- Events.ITERATION_STARTED: min/index: (1.387670636177063e-06, 14) max/index: (1.7620623111724854e-06, 0) mean: 1.457263692827837e-06 std: 8.268084883411575e-08 total: 2.9145274311304092e-05
Handlers names: []
- Events.ITERATION_COMPLETED: min/index: (2.0246952772140503e-06, 19) max/index: (2.620276063680649e-06, 0) mean: 2.1990854293107986e-06 std: 1.2816821026717662e-07 total: 4.398170858621597e-05
Handlers names: []
- Events.EPOCH_COMPLETED: min/index: (1.810956746339798e-06, 1) max/index: (2.0372681319713593e-06, 0) mean: 1.9241124391555786e-06 std: 1.600263175305372e-07 total: 3.848224878311157e-06
Handlers names: []
- Events.COMPLETED: min/index: (2.1900050342082977e-06, 0) max/index: (2.1900050342082977e-06, 0) mean: 2.1900050342082977e-06 std: nan total: 2.1900050342082977e-06
Handlers names: []
Thanks!

Your snippet doesn't work for me... I got the following stack (print uncommented) : <denchmark-code>0.4.0 OrderedDict([('processing_stats', OrderedDict([('min/index', (9.522002073936164e-06, 9)), ('max/index', (1.8264996469952166e-05, 2.582999150035903e-05)]), 'total_time': tensor(0.0001)}), ('event_handlers_names', {'EPOCH_STARTED_names': [], 'EPOCH_COMPLETED_names': [], 'STARTED_names': ['BasicTimeProfiler._as_first_started'], </denchmark-code>
Ok, we don't have the same version (0.4.0 vs 0.4.0.dev20200206) maybe it could be a clue. Any idea ? pytorch installed from conda (but I suppose it doesn't matter).
I got it, while updating to the master. Thanks for pointing out the bug ! cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ykumards>@ykumards</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sdesrozis>@sdesrozis</denchmark-link> bug should be fixed now on the master.
